intro: Zanthoxylum ubanghense, commonly known as the African prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm their efficacy. Zanthoxylum ubanghense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
